summary: The document comprises records from the Assassination Records Review Board, focusing on the HSCA's staff payroll records, including those of Nancy S. Jenkins. It details document status notifications, reasons for postponements, and payroll authorizations. Jenkins' resume and references, emphasizing her long tenure with Congressman Thomas N. Downing, are also included. The document underscores the balance between public interest in historical records and privacy concerns, particularly regarding Social Security numbers.
key_findings: Partial postponement of the document was due to its significant historical interest and the absence of harm from release.
Postponements were mainly because of the inclusion of Social Security numbers, considered an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.
Nancy S. Jenkins' employment records and resume highlight her extensive experience and responsibilities while working for Congressman Thomas N. Downing.
The document illustrates the procedural and ethical considerations in releasing historical records, weighing privacy against public interest.
